Description: Provides and facilitates workshops for veterans and their families. Provides peer-to-peer support groups for Veterans, as well as developing strategies on how to deal with environmental pressures and barriers Veterans and their families may be dealing with.
Provides a wide variety of health and social services to veterans and their families.

Offers free mental health and chemical dependency assessment and referral services for children, adolescents, adults, and seniors; secure crisis unit; inpatient stabilization; partial hospitalization; intensive outpatient programs; adolescent specialization in adolescent self-injury and eating disorders; military specialized services.

Organization Name: FORT WORTH VET CENTER | FORT WORTH SITE | VETERANS SERVICES
Description: Provides outpatient psychological counseling including: Individual and group counseling for Veterans, service members, and their families Family counseling for military related issues Bereavement (grief) counseling Military sexual trauma counseling and referral Community outreach and education Substance abuse assessment and referral Employment referral Referral of other VA services

Organization Name: RECOVERY RESOURCE COUNCIL | MAIN OFFICE | ENDURING FAMILIES VETERAN SERVICES
Description: Provides counseling to North Texas veterans and their families. Issues addressed include (but not limited to): Post-traumatic stress Depression Anxiety Military sexual trauma Reintegration issues Marriage challenges Parenting difficulties Substance use
